Ever have to use a waist level finder in a sunny day? Or maybe you were in a low light situation and every lumen counted? Well fret no more with my mighty invention! /!/ The Old Sock Sleeve! Basically any light that comes in at an angle or that seeps through the hinges will make your ground glass a reflective surface as opposed to a projecting surface if the light coming in through the top overrides the one coming in through the bottom. SUre you can cup your hands but how will you press the shutter now? And thats assuming you have a strap or tripod. So here comes:

Use an old stretched out sock which you cut and slip it over the brackets and watch a whole new world of brightness
